body_html:
@jhetherly : Sorry for delay - TensorFlow is my hobby, not primary work area. Yes, I will upstream these changes too, hope on this weekand. About your earlier questoions - this PR does not have changes for gradient, that's why there are no new tests for it. New PR will have them - I already wrote it. As far as I know all tests for this operation passed successfully on my machine.

By the way, is it correct that infrastructure in this repository will not allow to merge PR with broken tests? I am very new in TensorFlow development... but as far as I know some projects implement such policy...

body:
@jhetherly : Sorry for delay - TensorFlow is my hobby, not primary work area. Yes, I will upstream these changes too, hope on this weekand. About your earlier questoions -  this PR does not have changes for gradient, that's why there are no new tests for it. New PR will have them  - I already wrote it. As far as I know all tests for this operation passed successfully on my machine. 

By the way, is it correct that infrastructure in this repository will not allow to merge PR with broken tests?  I am very new in TensorFlow development... but as far as I know some projects implement such policy...
